name: Aspidogyne argentea
description: Aspidogyne argentea is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Costa Rica, Panama, and Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (10-20 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive silver vein patterns. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Orchids have highly specialized flowers designed for specific pollinators. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant brings exotic elegance and sophistication to any environment. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive silver-veined foliage.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
